title: Biomedical Data Integration - Shared Fields Registry
description: Comprehensive registry of shared fields across 9 biomedical data categories, enabling cross-category data integration and linking

shared_fields.definition: Official HGNC gene symbol representing a specific gene locus
PubMed unique identifier for biomedical literature references
UniProt Knowledge Base accession number for protein sequences
PubChem Compound Identifier for chemical substances
NCBI Taxonomy database identifier for organisms
NCBI Entrez Gene database unique identifier
International Chemical Identifier hash key for unique compound identification
Mondo Disease Ontology identifier for disease classification
ChEMBL database identifier for bioactive molecules
Digital Object Identifier for scholarly publications
Ensembl database gene identifier
Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology identifier
Canonical SMILES notation for molecular structure representation
Medical Subject Headings vocabulary identifier
Human Phenotype Ontology term identifier
DrugBank database identifier for drugs and drug targets
Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man identifier for genetic disorders
Human Metabolome Database identifier for metabolites
Gene Ontology term identifier for functional annotation
KEGG pathway database identifier
Protein Data Bank identifier for 3D protein structures
Chemical Abstracts Service registry number for chemical substances
Molecular weight of a compound in Daltons
Molecular formula representing atomic composition
Chromosome identifier for genomic location
Genomic coordinate position (1-based)
Orphanet rare disease identifier
International Classification of Diseases 10th revision code
Disease Ontology identifier
Unified Medical Language System Concept Unique Identifier
NCBI Reference Sequence identifier for nucleotide/protein sequences
HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee identifier
Clinical interpretation of genetic variant pathogenicity
Unique identifier for genetic variants (dbSNP rsID or similar)
Reactome pathway database identifier
Experimental Factor Ontology identifier
PubMed Central article identifier
KEGG Compound database identifier
KEGG Orthology identifier for functional orthologs
Uberon cross-species anatomy ontology identifier
FooDB food compound database identifier
InterPro protein family/domain identifier
ClinVar database variant identifier
Numerical confidence score for data quality or interaction strength
Scientific name of the organism
Wikidata item identifier for cross-linking entities

gene.description: Central hub for gene-related identifiers enabling cross-database gene linking

protein.description: Central hub for protein identifiers linking sequence, structure, and function

compound.description: Central hub for chemical compound identifiers linking drugs, metabolites, and natural products

disease.description: Central hub for disease and phenotype identifiers enabling clinical data integration

publication.description: Central hub for literature identifiers linking research evidence

identifier_resolution_priority: Use InChI Key for compound identity (structure-based, unambiguous)
Use gene_symbol with HGNC validation for gene identity
Use UniProt accession for protein identity
Use MONDO ID for disease unification (maps to OMIM, Orphanet, etc.)
Use PMID for literature references (most comprehensive coverage)

cross_reference_strategies.name: Structure-based compound linking
cross_reference_strategies.method: Match InChI Keys across compound databases for exact structural identity
cross_reference_strategies.fallback: Use canonical SMILES with standardization, then PubChem CID

cross_reference_strategies.name: Gene-centric integration
cross_reference_strategies.method: Use HGNC symbol as primary, cross-reference via Entrez/Ensembl
cross_reference_strategies.fallback: Alias resolution through HGNC multi-symbol search

cross_reference_strategies.name: Disease ontology unification
cross_reference_strategies.method: Use MONDO as integration layer, map from OMIM/HPO/Orphanet
cross_reference_strategies.fallback: MeSH or UMLS CUI for broader coverage

cross_reference_strategies.name: Literature evidence linking
cross_reference_strategies.method: Use PMID as primary key, resolve DOIs via CrossRef
cross_reference_strategies.fallback: Title/author fuzzy matching for unlisted publications

data_quality_recommendations: Always validate identifiers against primary authorities
Use confidence scores to filter low-quality associations
Track provenance through source database citations
Apply cardinality constraints during data integration
Implement version tracking for ontology terms
